intro: Eleocharis piauhiensis, commonly known as the Piauhi sedge, is a flowering plant species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like flower clusters. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, adapting to saturated soil conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
